revised_item: Being bothered by things that don't usually bother you.
Not feeling like eating; having a poor appetite.
Feeling that you cannot shake off the blues even with help from family or friends.
Having trouble keeping your mind on what you are doing.
Feeling that everything you do is an effort.
Thinking your life has been a failure.
Taking more than 30 minutes to fall asleep.
Waking up in the middle of the night.
Awakening more than 30 minutes before needed.
Feeling sad as if someone close to me died or left.
Feeling a need to eat more frequently than usual.
Feeling uninterested in activities you used to enjoy.
Being restless and unable to keep still.
Headaches or pains in your stomach, back or joints.
Feeling your heart beating faster than normal.
Feeling rejected, slighted, criticized or hurt by others.
Feeling physically weighted down and without physical energy.
Feeling like you are being punished.
Thinking that you've done everything wrong.
Feeling ill-defined discomfort or inner turmoil.
Feeling that your mood doesn't improve when something good happens
short_label: Mood not responsive to good things

revised_item: Finding it hard to make decisions.
